db_urls.name: PFAM
db_urls.citation: Pfam: The protein families database in 2021 J. Mistry, S. Chuguransky, L. Williams, M. Qureshi, G.A. Salazar, E.L.L. Sonnhammer, S.C.E. Tosatto, L. Paladin, S. Raj, L.J. Richardson, R.D. Finn, A. Bateman Nucleic Acids Research (2020) doi: 10.1093/nar/gkaa913
db_urls.notes: Contains pretrained bitscore cutoffs: GA, TC, NC

db_urls.name: DFAM
db_urls.citation: Storer, J., Hubley, R., Rosen, J. et al. The Dfam community resource of transposable element families, sequence models, and genome annotations. Mobile DNA 12, 2 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1186/s13100-020-00230-y

db_urls.name: DFAM_curatedonly
db_urls.citation: Storer, J., Hubley, R., Rosen, J. et al. The Dfam community resource of transposable element families, sequence models, and genome annotations. Mobile DNA 12, 2 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1186/s13100-020-00230-y

db_urls.name: KOFAM
db_urls.citation: Aramaki, T., Blanc-Mathieu, R., Endo, H., Ohkubo, K., Kanehisa, M., Goto, S., & Ogata, H. (2019). Kofamkoala: Kegg Ortholog assignment based on profile HMM and adaptive score threshold. Bioinformatics, 36(7), 2251–2252. https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btz859

db_urls.name: NCBI
db_urls.citation: Lu S, Wang J, Chitsaz F, Derbyshire MK, Geer RC, Gonzales NR, Gwadz M, Hurwitz DI, Marchler GH, Song JS, Thanki N, Yamashita RA, Yang M, Zhang D, Zheng C, Lanczycki CJ, Marchler-Bauer A. CDD/SPARCLE: the conserved domain database in 2020. Nucleic Acids Res. 2020 Jan 8;48(D1):D265-D268. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkz991. PMID: 31777944; PMCID: PMC6943070.

db_urls.name: FOAM
db_urls.citation: Emmanuel Prestat, Maude M. David, Jenni Hultman, Neslihan Taş, Regina Lamendella, Jill Dvornik, Rachel Mackelprang, David D. Myrold, Ari Jumpponen, Susannah G. Tringe, Elizabeth Holman, Konstantinos Mavromatis, Janet K. Jansson, FOAM (Functional Ontology Assignments for Metagenomes): a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) database with environmental focus, Nucleic Acids Research, Volume 42, Issue 19, 29 October 2014, Page e145, https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gku702

db_urls.name: AntiFam
db_urls.citation: Eberhardt RY, Haft DH, Punta M, Martin M, O'Donovan C, Bateman A. AntiFam: a tool to help identify spurious ORFs in protein annotation. Database (Oxford). 2012 Mar 20;2012:bas003. doi: 10.1093/database/bas003. PMID: 22434837; PMCID: PMC3308159.
db_urls.notes: For identification of spurious ORF predictions. Contains bitscore cutoffs.

db_urls.name: dbCAN
db_urls.citation: Yin Y*, Mao X*, Yang JC, Chen X, Mao F and Xu Y, dbCAN: a web resource for automated carbohydrate-active enzyme annotation, Nucleic Acids Res. 2012 Jul;40(Web Server issue):W445-51

db_urls.name: CRISPRCasFinder
db_urls.citation: Couvin D, Bernheim A, Toffano-Nioche C, Touchon M, Michalik J, Néron B, Rocha EPC, Vergnaud G, Gautheret D, Pourcel C. CRISPRCasFinder, an update of CRISRFinder, includes a portable version, enhanced performance and integrates search for Cas proteins. Nucleic Acids Res. 2018 Jul 2;46(W1):W246-W251. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gky425 PMID:29790974

db_urls.name: DefenseFinder
db_urls.citation: Systematic and quantitative view of the antiviral arsenal of prokaryotes Nature Communication, 2022, Tesson F., Hervé A. , Mordret E., Touchon M., d’Humières C., Cury J., Bernheim A.

db_urls.name: padloc
db_urls.citation: Payne, L. J., Todeschini, T. C., Wu, Y., Perry, B. J., Ronson, C. W., Fineran, P. C., Nobrega, F. L., Jackson, S. A. (2021) Identification and classification of antiviral defence systems in bacteria and archaea with PADLOC reveals new system types. Nucleic Acids Research, 49, 10868-10878. doi: https://doi.org/10/gzgh

db_urls.name: VOGdb
db_urls.notes: Used for identification of viral protein orthologs.

db_urls.name: Resfam
db_urls.citation: Gibson MK, Forsberg KJ, Dantas G. Improved annotation of antibiotic resistance functions reveals microbial resistomes cluster by ecology. The ISME Journal. 2014, doi:ISMEJ.2014.106
db_urls.notes: Resfams is a curated database of protein families and associated profile hidden Markov models (HMMs), confirmed for antibiotic resistance function and organized by ontology.

db_urls.name: CANT-HYD
db_urls.citation: Khot V, Zorz J, Gittins DA, Chakraborty A, Bell E, Bautista MA, Paquette AJ, Hawley AK, Novotnik B, Hubert CRJ, Strous M and Bhatnagar S (2022) CANT-HYD: A Curated Database of Phylogeny-Derived Hidden Markov Models for Annotation of Marker Genes Involved in Hydrocarbon Degradation. Front. Microbiol. 12:764058. doi: 10.3389/fmicb.2021.764058
db_urls.notes: Hydrocarbon degradation related genes. Contain TC and NC bitscore cutoffs.

db_urls.name: MEHG
db_urls.citation: McDaniel E.A., Peterson B., Stevens S.L.R., Tran P.Q., Anantharaman K., McMahon K.D. Expanded Phylogenetic Diversity and Metabolic Flexibility of Microbial Mercury Methylation. mSystems. Aug 2020, 5 (4) e00299-20; DOI: 10.1128/mSystems.00299-20
db_urls.notes: Mercury methylation protein HMMs.  hgcA.hmm contains TC cutoffs, and the TIGRFAM HMMs contain GA, TC, NC; other custom HMMs do not contain bitscore cutoffs.

db_urls.name: barrnap
db_urls.notes: 16S HMMs built from Rfam seed alignments; lacking covariance models.
